message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.GT 

This paper deals with the multi-armed bandit problem, which is a well-known problem in machine learning and optimization. The paper presents a solution for the problem in a very general setting where the strategies form a metric space, and the payoff function satisfies a Lipschitz condition with respect to the metric. This makes it likely that the paper would be classified under the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) or information theory (cs.IT). Additionally, the paper deals with optimization and algorithm design, which could lead to it being classified under the sub-categories of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) or artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper also discusses game theory, which could lead to it being classified under the sub-category of game theory (cs.GT).
